ygData.subject: Re: Instruments vs. Melee quandry
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Well, it hasn t happened at L49 so I m not holding my breath that it will happen at 50 as the song for that level appears to be an Anthem upgrade. The best
ygData.messageBody:
On Tue, Sep 07/99, JasonF <JasonF@...> wrote:
>
> I fully expect that one of the subtleties of the Bard class is that as you
> mature into the role of Bard that your songs will, over time, start to do more
> damage than your weapons when instruments are equipped. So if you're "joe
> bard" that plays 6 hours a week and doesn't read these messages or do as much
> research into your class as we obviously do, you can still play the game as a
> "bad tank with a healing song". However, if you're like us and divorce your
> wife 'cause your family is keeping your from getting to level 50, you develop
> your skills more fully.
>
> Where is the crossover point that songs do more damage? I dunno, I'm only
> level 20 and I would very seriously doubt that I've reached it yet. My guess
> is that by around level 30 it should be noticable. I would think that by
> level 50 it should be blatanly obvious to you that you should use songs and
> instruments. Can any 50th bards confirm this and/or estimate where the
> crossover point is from weapons to songs?

Well, it hasn't happened at L49 so I'm not holding my breath that it
will happen at 50 as the song for that level appears to be an Anthem
upgrade. The best damage you could probably do with songs would be the
L48 song and CoD, as both are string songs, and they definately wouldn't
beat the damage you could do with dual Ykesha's. In fact they don't even
come close to the damage you can do with a claw and dirk from what I can
see. As well, that means you would also only be able to play one other
party buff song, and our best attack song at that level is berzerker's
which is horn. If any other L48+ bard has figured out a way to do more
damage with instruments I'd appreciate hearing it.


Sometimes when I'm in a bad mood I think that if it wasn't for the mana
song, Bards would be lower on the list for getting in a group than a
rogue in most people's eyes. (assuming both characters are played well
by people who are fun to have in your group)
